meanings.definition: lionisers: to treat or regard someone as a celebrity or hero
meanings.sent1: The fans lionisers their favorite singer after the concert.
meanings.sent2: She lionisers the actor by collecting all his movie posters.
meanings.sent3: The kids lionisers their teacher when she dresses up as a superhero for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: In the eyes of her little sister, she lionisers as a real-life princess.
meanings.sent5: The community lionisers the firefighter for his bravery in saving the cat from the tree.

meanings.definition: lionisers: a person who treats or regards someone as a celebrity or hero
meanings.sent1: The lionisers gathered outside the actor's house for a chance to meet him.
meanings.sent2: She became a lionisers after meeting her favorite author at a book signing.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly declared herself a lionisers of her older brother's soccer skills.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the lionisers of the local basketball team, always cheering them on.
meanings.sent5: The lionisers was thrilled to get an autograph from the famous singer.
